snippet: The Vatican’s chief financial official said Thursday that the money had been left out of the church’s main balance sheets.
abstract: Cardinal George Pell, Vatican's chief financial officer, reports his staff has discovered hundreds of millions of euros in assorted accounts that Vatican was not aware of; Pell does not identify where cash was hidden or by whom, or indicate there is any malpractice involved; notes that Vatican departments have long had independent finances, which might explain why his own branch had been left in the dark about the money.
lead_paragraph: The Vatican’s chief financial official said Thursday that the money had been left out of the church’s main balance sheets.

headline.main: Vatican Finds Stash of Money ‘Tucked Away’
headline.print_headline: Vatican Finds Stash of Money ‘Tucked Away’
